stakes.heading: The Problem With How You Monitor Today

late.title: You're Late

losing.title: You're Losing
losing.text: One undetected stress event can cost more than your annual monitoring investment.

explainer.heading: How Vita 1 Actually Works
paragraphs: Vita 1 measures what's happening INSIDE your plants—not around them.

Traditional sensors tell you the air is 60°F. Vita 1 tells you your plants are experiencing cold stress because the heater failed. Traditional monitoring shows humidity is normal. Vita 1 catches the water stress your plants feel before leaves show symptoms.
It's the difference between knowing the weather forecast and knowing how your body actually feels. Your plants now have a voice.

finalCta.headline: Stop Guessing. Start Listening.
finalCta.subheadline: Schedule a 15-minute call to see if Vita 1 is right for your operation.

hero.headline: Vita 1
hero.subheadline: The world's first monitoring system that reads and interprets plant electrical biosignals.

stakes.heading: The Technical Gap in Traditional Monitoring

latency.title: Symptom Latency
latency.text: Visual symptoms are lagging indicators. By the time you see wilt or discoloration, yield loss has already occurred.

proxy.title: The Proxy Problem
proxy.text: Environment ≠ Plant. Measuring air temperature and soil moisture is only a proxy for what the plant is actually experiencing.

blindspots.title: Temporal Blind Spots
blindspots.text: Spot checks and 15-minute sensor intervals miss critical rapid-onset stress events like irrigation failure or sudden heat spikes.

stakes.quote: "We need to know BEFORE the damage is done."

threeStressors.heading: Three Things That Keep Growers Up at Night
threeStressors.subheading: Vita 1 addresses the core risks in your operation

stressors.title: Water Waste
stressors.description:
Running pumps when your plants are already full wastes fuel, water, and money.

**Vita 1 tells you the moment your plants stop drinking.**

stressors.title: Nutrient Leaching
stressors.description:
Over-irrigating during tuber initiation or critical growth phases leaches expensive nitrogen and increases disease pressure.

**Plant signals show when to stop.**

stressors.title: Pests and Diseases
stressors.description:
Plant stress opens the door for pests and disease. By catching stress signals early, you can act on time.

**Prevent outbreaks before symptoms appear.**

viewer360.keyboardHint: Use arrow keys or drag to rotate • Click dots to explore features

enclosure.label: Transparent Weatherproof Enclosure
enclosure.description: Crystal-clear housing allows visual inspection of internal components while protecting electronics from moisture and environmental stress.

qrCode.label: QR Code & Serial Number
qrCode.description: Unique identifier for device registration, tracking, and support. Scan to access sensor data and configuration.

circuitry.label: Internal Circuitry Visible
circuitry.description: Swiss-engineered PCB with precision biosignal processing. Visual verification of component integrity through transparent case.

clips.label: Green Plant Attachment Clips
clips.description: Spring-loaded clips securely attach sensor to plant stems without damage. Tool-free installation and repositioning.

tube.label: Elongated Tube Design
tube.description: Slim profile minimizes visual impact in growing area. Houses electrodes for optimal plant signal measurement.

pcb.label: Green PCB Visible
pcb.description: High-quality circuit board with signal conditioning and wireless communication components. European manufacturing standards.

bracket.label: Mounting Bracket
bracket.description: Adjustable bracket for stem-free mounting options. Allows installation on support structures or plant containers.

wire.label: Wire Connection Point
wire.description: Electrode wire connection for biosignal measurement. Redundant contact points ensure reliable electrical connection.

formFactor.label: Compact Form Factor
formFactor.description: Optimized size balances functionality with minimal crop interference. Designed for dense planting environments.

plantSignal.heading: From Plant to Dashboard
plantSignal.subheading: Beyond soil sensors. Beyond proxies. Direct plant communication.

steps.title: The Plant Speaks
steps.description: Vita 1 clips onto the stem and reads electrical biosignals.

steps.title: Signal Processing
steps.description: Vita 1 tech interprets the signals and translates them into actionable insights.

steps.title: You Get Alerts
steps.description: Plain-English notifications tell you exactly what's right/wrong and where.

plantSignal.callout: Traditional sensors measure the environment around your plants. Vita 1 measures what's happening inside them.

service.heading: We Don't Ship and Wish You Luck
service.description: Every Vita 1 installation includes professional setup, training, and ongoing support. We're partners, not vendors.

items.title: Simple Investment Model
items.description: Pay for the equipment once, with a yearly subscription renewal. No hidden fees, no surprises—transparent pricing that makes planning easy.

items.title: Long Battery Life
items.description: Sensors last months on a single charge. For continuous operation, optional solar panel models are available for truly set-and-forget deployment.

items.title: Beyond the tech
items.description: Biweekly check-ins ensure you're getting maximum value from your data. We help with insight interpretation and decision-making support—we're partners, not just vendors.

items.question: What crops does it work with?
items.answer: Vita 1 is validated for greenhouse vegetables, berries, potatoes, apples, and grapes, with the ability to validate new crops based on grower needs.

items.question: Can it be used outdoors?
items.answer: Yes—the sensors are wireless, battery-powered, and weatherproof, making them ideal for outdoor crops where monitoring plant stress in real-time is critical.

items.question: Does it notify stress changes proactively?
items.answer: Yes—Vita 1 sends automatic alerts when it detects plant stress. You'll be notified 24-48 hours before visible symptoms appear, giving you time to act.

items.question: Does it require a wireless connection?
items.answer: No—the sensors work wirelessly using a long-range radio. You only need internet at one spot where the gateway sits, not throughout your entire operation, making it ideal for rural areas.

items.question: Does it integrate with existing data platforms?
items.answer: Vita 1 comes with its own data platform. However, custom integrations with existing data platforms may be possible depending on your setup.

items.question: Is my data safe?
items.answer: Yes—your data is secure and belongs to you, protected by industry-standard security and European privacy regulations.

items.question: What is the battery lifetime?
items.answer: Battery on the sensor lasts for several months without need of replacing. We also offer a solar-powered version that extends this lifetime even further.

items.question: How many sensors do I need?
items.answer: It depends on your setup—greenhouses may need about 8 sensors per hectare, while uniform outdoor crops like potatoes need just 1-2 sensors per 2 hectares. We'll help you determine the exact number based on your operation.

finalCta.headline: Ready to Listen to Your Plants?

hero.headline: We Are The Bridge
hero.subheadline: Connecting Swiss precision to American fields. European engineering to practical reality.

mauricio.name: MAURICIO MANOTAS, CEO
mauricio.bio: 30 years in agriculture across North America, Latin America, and Europe. From the flower fields of Colombia to greenhouses in Canada. Field-tested in 35°C and -10°C.
mauricio.quote: I've seen too many growers buy expensive equipment that ends up collecting dust because no one helped them actually use it. That's not how we work.

bridges.heading: Bridging Worlds
narratives: Mauricio has spent 30 years walking the line between two worlds: the cutting-edge precision of European agricultural technology and the practical, boots-in-the-mud reality of American and Latin American farming.

He's seen too many growers buy expensive equipment that ends up collecting dust—not because the technology wasn't good, but because no one helped them actually use it. European manufacturers create brilliant solutions in controlled environments. American growers need those solutions to work at 6 AM when it's -10°F and the truck is waiting.
That's where Green Laniel comes in. We don't just sell Swiss technology—we translate it. We install it. We train you. And when something goes wrong at 2 AM, we answer the phone.
bridges.valueStatement: Swiss precision meets American service. European engineering meets practical reality.

vivent.heading: Our Technology Partners
vivent.description: We partner with world class European partners to bring spearhead technology to the American context. At Green Laniel, the best agricultural technology meets our 30+ year field experience in American fields.
vivent.note: Green Laniel is the exclusive Americas distributor, providing localized installation, training, and support.
